Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a light-brown ribbed pottery vessel, the fabric is black towards the inner surface, exterior covered with a red/brown slip and remains of at least thirteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now very worn, and containing a contract for service.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.133)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87646) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87646)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 162 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
